intro: Heracleum sibiricum f. angustisectum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Siberian cowparsley, is a variant of the Siberian cowparsley characterized by its slender, elongated leaves. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Its flowers are small and yellowish-green, arranged in complex umbels, and it produces elongated, ribbed fruits. This form is distinguished by its narrower leaf segments compared to the typical form of Heracleum sibiricum.
